attributes.action: Provide university students discounted TFL travel through a zip card.
attributes.additional_details: Us students should be paying less compared to adults. Not all students take maintenance loans to cover their travel costs especially because of the high rates of interest with the loans. The cost of living is now high more than ever. In addition to that, no employer pays 18 year olds an equal and fair pay. Fix the TFL charging system for university students!
attributes.background: I want the government to allow students discounted travel through a zip card. I’m 18, I’ve just started my undergraduate course at university. I have to travel from zone 4 to zone 1 everyday it costs me £4.40 a journey. £8.80 a day!!! I work part time and one day of travel is more than my hourly pay

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. It is the responsibility of Transport for London, the Mayor of London and the London Assembly.

The London Assembly has its own petitions process. You can find out more about how to petition the London Assembly here: https://www.london.gov.uk/about-us/london-assembly/petitions

We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Fund free travel for 16-19 year olds that are in further education
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/643895

Nationalise all public transport and make it free for everyone at all times
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/639987
